Title: Improving problem-solving skills through Logo programming language
Affiliations: Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Authors with affiliations: Pardamean, B., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Suparyanto, T., Bioinformatics and Data Science Research Center, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia; Evelyn, Bina Nusantara University, Jl. Kebon Jeruk Raya No. 27, Jakarta, Indonesia
Abstract: The effect of Logo programming language on problem solving skills was investigated in this study. Eighty-five fifth-grade students were assigned to either an experimental or control Logo group. They were pre-tested to assess baseline receptiveness to figural and logical word problem-solving skills. After eight weeks of learning, the Logo experimental group had significantly higher scores than the control group on the problem-solving skills tests (assessing both figural and logical word problem-solving skills). The result revealed significant differences in the figural problem-solving skill between the Logo experimental and control groups. An implication was that Logo programming exercised skills are more critical and relevant to the figural problem-solving skill. Possible alternative explanations and suggestions are provided for future research endeavors. © Wydawnictwo Adam Marszałek Toruń 2015.
Author Keywords: Figural; Logical word; Logo; Problem solving; Programming language
